channel.title: Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence
channel.description: Posts from Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

item.title: And for this week's #CAAPV #DidYouKnow: even when someone...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

And for this week's #CAAPV #DidYouKnow: even when someone charged with a crime "wins," their lives are never the same, nor are their pocketbooks.

If we are to #HoldCopsAccountable, we must remember that #DAsAreCopsToo and work to hold them accountable, too.
item.author: Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

item.title: What happened? The officer lost two days of pay, and will be...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

What happened? The officer lost two days of pay, and will be back on the street responding to our vulnerable citizens, including victims of domestic violence. #CAAPV #HoldCopsAccountable #DefundThePolice

“Cochran then responded in a text: “I’ll bet if I beat your ass on the regular, you’d be incapable of staying away from me.”

Cochran, who joined the department in 2017, told internal affairs investigators that the woman had confided in him that she had been in unhealthy rela...tionships in the past and that he was trying to “indicate he was better than the previous men she had dated,” his disciplinary letter states. He said the text he sent was poorly worded.”

https://www.denverpost.com/…/denver-police-domestic-viole…/…

See MoreA Denver police officer will lose two days of pay for telling a woman who said she did not want to go on a second date that he bet she would be interested in him if he beat her.

denverpost.com

Denver police officer disciplined for suggesting that a woman would be interested in dating him if he beat her

A Denver police officer will lose two days of pay for telling a woman who said she did not want to go on a second date that he bet she would be interested in him if he beat her.A Denver police officer will lose two days of pay for telling a woman who said she did not want to go on a second date that he bet she would be interested in him if he beat her.

item.title: Let. Kids. Learn. “Having toys in my house is something I...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

Let. Kids. Learn.

“Having toys in my house is something I thought I never had to think of,” she said. “It never crossed my mind that toys could be seen as a threat.”

https://apple.news/AIgMWgS5pSSaNrhyAGxEiSQ

"How do I protect my son, what do I have him do [when] playing with a toy in the privacy of your own home is a threat?" the 7th grader's mother told BuzzFeed News.

apple.news

A Colorado School Suspended A 12-Year-Old Black Boy And Called The Police To His Home After He Waved A Toy Gun During A Virtual Class — BuzzFeed News

"How do I protect my son, what do I have him do [when] playing with a toy in the privacy of your own home is a threat?" the 7th grader's mother told BuzzFeed News."How do I protect my son, what do I have him do [when] playing with a toy in the privacy of your own home is a threat?" the 7th grader's mother told BuzzFeed News.

item.title: Roughly 14% of DPD’s dispatch was for violent crime (which,...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

Roughly 14% of DPD’s dispatch was for violent crime (which, mind you, includes “riots”), which account for about 17% of officer’s time on the street.

Do not succumb to the fearmongering that if we defund the police that we will be unsafe. It’s simply untrue.

#CAAPV #DefundThePolice #AbolitionNow

...

https://www.denverpost.com/…/denver-police-officer-time-jo…/

See MoreThough violent crime generates the most headlines, Denver’s patrol officers spent more than 80% of their time dealing with other less serious complaints and a wide array of community tasks.

denverpost.com

How do cops spend their time? As Denver debates police funding, these numbers offer an inside look

Though violent crime generates the most headlines, Denver’s patrol officers spent more than 80% of their time dealing with other less serious complaints and a wide array of community tasks.Though violent crime generates the most headlines, Denver’s patrol officers spent more than 80% of their time dealing with other less serious complaints and a wide array of community tasks.

item.title: From Laurie Kepros. Stand in solidarity this Thursday, #CAAPV! ...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

From Laurie Kepros. Stand in solidarity this Thursday, #CAAPV!

“In case it interests, THURSDAY 9/24/20 from 8am to 2pm, there will be a protest at the 10th Circuit in Denver in opposition to the court's August decision in Millard erroneously finding Colorado's sex offender registry is not punishment. For more details contact WAR at the email address below. All are welcome, masks are encouraged:
On Thursday, September 24, 2020, Women Against Registry and others dedicated to c...hange in America’s sexual offense registration laws will be in front of the 10th Circuit Appeals Court building from 8 AM to 2 PM to protest the 10th Circuit’s ruling. The message is simple – the registry IS punishment. As we know it has altered the lives of human beings who merely want to have their lives fully restored.

We invite each and every person experiencing the punitiveness and stigma of registration to join us. Each man, woman or child can make a difference. Begin right now making plans to be part of the demonstration and/or donating to the initiative to help with travel, lodging, materials and brochures which are being designed as we speak. It will be a great time to meet others from like-minded organizations and be a part of something BIG!
Let us know if you will be joining us so that we can keep you apprised of on-going plans and developments.

For more information, contact... 10thcirteam@warfamilyfoundation.org”

See More

item.title: After 23 years, 6 trials, and four death sentences all secured...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

After 23 years, 6 trials, and four death sentences all secured through deplorable prosecutorial misconduct, Curtis is free. And thankfully living proof of why our states are not equipped to kill.

https://www.apmreports.org/…/charges-against-curtis-flowers…

The Mississippi man who was tried six times for the same crime and whose case was the subject of Season 2 of the APM Reports podcast In the Dark sees his two-decade saga come to an end.

apmreports.org

Charges against Curtis Flowers are dropped

The Mississippi man who was tried six times for the same crime and whose case was the subject of Season 2 of the APM Reports podcast In the Dark sees his two-decade saga come to an end.The Mississippi man who was tried six times for the same crime and whose case was the subject of Season 2 of the APM Reports podcast In the Dark sees his two-decade saga come to an end.

item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

If we ever hope to #EndPoliceViolence, we must stop policing children when they are trying to learn.

#CAAPV #LetKidsBeKids #StopTheSchoolToPrisonPipeline

item.title: Thanks to the Denver Westword for covering our...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

Thanks to the Denver Westword for covering our #DecarcerationDayOfAction Rally yesterday, and for spreading the word that a jail or prison sentence should not be a death sentence, and that Governor Jared Polis should act to bring our neighbors home.

https://www.westword.com/…/colorado-prison-governor-release…

#decarcerationday #FreeThemAll #covidjustice #carenotcages #endmassincarceration #COVIDcolorado #doyourpart #bringourneighborshome #redemptionisreal #clemencyiscompassion #CAAPV

Close to 900 inmates in Colorado's prisons have contracted COVID-19.

westword.com

Advocates Urging Colorado to Release Medically Vulnerable Prisoners

Close to 900 inmates in Colorado's prisons have contracted COVID-19.Close to 900 inmates in Colorado's prisons have contracted COVID-19.

item.title: A successful #DecarcerationDayOfAction. Thanks to Joyce...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

A successful #DecarcerationDayOfAction. Thanks to Joyce Akhahenda, Dr. Apryl Alexander, Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver, Elisabeth Epps/Colorado Freedom Fund, Abron from Second Chance Center, and Gerry for speaking truth to power and for telling beautiful stories of humanity and redemption.

As #CAAPV’s own Nicole Duncan said:

There are 36,000 people in jails and prisons in Colorado (this does not include juveniles and people in ICE Detention).

...

830 have tested positive for Covid (these are the known numbers).

3 have died (these are the known numbers).

You’ve seen what happens to the people we can see on the media. We see how people are treated out in the open. I can’t imagine the treatment of the people I can’t see.

We have to fight for the ones we can’t see.
We have to fight for the ones we can’t see.
We have to fight for the ones we can’t see.

#CAAPV #decarcerationday #FreeThemAll #covidjustice #carenotcages #endmassincarceration #COVIDcolorado #doyourpart #bringourneighborshome #redemptionisreal #clemencyiscompassion

See More

item.author: Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

item.title: Anthony is an 84-year-old grandfather who has spent 30 years...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

Anthony is an 84-year-old grandfather who has spent 30 years incarcerated for a series of robberies and spends each day confined in a wheelchair in his cell in Sterling, terrified of catching COVID-19.

“I fear the way the COVID-19 has ravaged this facility. It has put a great deal of us at-risk adult in harms way. For me, this can be a potential death sentence. At my age and with underlying health conditions, this feels like cruel and unusual punishment.”

— Anthony Martinez...

Anthony Martinez is an 84-year-old grandfather suffering from renal failure, as well as other serious medical conditions including dementia. He is currently incarcerated in the Sterling Correctional Facility, site of one of Colorado’s largest COVID-19 outbreaks with almost 600 active COVID-19 cases. He and his family are understandably terrified that he will catch the virus and die.

Anthony has spent over 30 years behind bars for a series of robberies. He has paid a substantial debt to society for these crimes. With his age and infirmity, no one can argue he is a public safety risk, but he has a substantial risk of becoming seriously ill or dying from COVID-19 if he remains incarcerated. Despite this, his special needs parole application was denied.

Anthony’s niece, Kelly, has a room in her home waiting for him to spend his final years. She says, “Only nine people on the side of the prison where my uncle is currently held are still negative for COVID-19. It’s all around him and it’s only a matter of time before he gets sick. I know my uncle is lonely and isolated. He uses a wheelchair, is hard of hearing and is locked in his cell almost all day. Prison is no place for elderly people. Please, I need my uncle home before he dies.”

In the midst of this public health crisis, incarcerated people as vulnerable as Anthony, could and should be immediately released to safely live out their remaining years with family. #decarcerationday #FreeThemAll #covidjustice #carenotcages #endmassincarceration #COVIDcolorado #doyourpart #bringourneighborshome #redemptionisreal #clemencyiscompassion

See More

item.title: Ronald Johnson is a 62-year-old father and grandfather who has...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

Ronald Johnson is a 62-year-old father and grandfather who has turned his life around in prison after being convicted of non-violent offenses related to substance abuse.

“I spent the first few years of my incarceration blaming my actions on my drug use. As I have grown, and looked into myself, I have come to take responsibility for the choices I made. Once I accepted the harm my role caused others, I actively sought out ways that I could make amends.”

— Ronald Johnson

...Continue Reading

item.title: #CAAPV! In support of #DecarcerationDay, take two minutes and...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

#CAAPV! In support of #DecarcerationDay, take two minutes and contact Governor Jared Polis and tell him to release our vulnerable neighbors in cages across the state.

Link to contact here: https://aclu-co.org/campaigns/covid-19-decarceration/

Links to the powerful stories of Anthony Martinez and Ronald Johnson here: https://youtu.be/g_9Or0Ap9oc and here: https://youtu.be/bUMtgiiOxxA

...

And finally, a link to a Change petition to support Ronald Johnson’s clemency petition here: https://www.change.org/FreeRonaldJohnson

item.author: Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

item.title: ‼️Today is the day‼️ Come stand with us on the steps of...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

‼️Today is the day‼️

Come stand with us on the steps of the People’s House and tell @govofco to stop fear mongering about the human beings - who are disproportionately Black, Brown, and Indigenous - languishing in Colorado ages, some never having been convicted of a crime. Stand with us while we tell @govofco that the people he is painting as “dangerous criminals” are human beings who don’t deserve to die. Stand with him while we tell him that compassionate release of the vul...nerable, the elderly, non-dangerous, and the non-convicted is an easy choice, and that if he wants us to be “safer at home,” that must include *all* Coloradans, and not just the ones who look like him.

And thanks to our friends at Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver for making this rad flyer and standing with us!

#CAAPV #Decarcerate

See More
